newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Wattyl sees 10-15 pct profit rise.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Wattyl sees 10-15 pct profit rise.

text.p: Paint manufacturer Wattyl Ltd said on Tuesday it expected a 10 to 15 percent increase in profit for the first six months of the current year to June 30.
"The first two months sales in July and August showed a significant improvement over 1995/96 with a corresponding lift in profits," chairman Murray Anderson told the annual meeting.
"September sales, however, were disappointing and took away some of the July-August improvement, but are still 13 percent above last year," he said.
"As a result, I would forecast a profit increase for the first six months of 10-15 percent with the ultimate result being very much dependent upon the next three months," Anderson said.
Wattyl reported a net profit of A$21.2 million for the year to June 30, down from A$33.78 million a year earlier.

"The 1995/96 year has certainly been the toughest year in the company's history," Anderson said, attributing much of the problem to a run-up in sales in 1995 to beat proposed taxes and a fall-off in the housing industry.
"It is probably true to say that we did not start on a cost cutting programme early enough and it did not begin to bite until the last quarter," he added.
Anderson said Wattyl's prospects in 1996/97 would very much depend on its Australian operations.
"The company has already taken steps to actively improve our situation and this is on-going," he said.
"We are very soundly based to take advantage of the general market conditions and will be doing so in the months ahead," he said.
